data.Title: Bing Launches AI-Powered Generative Search
data.Description: Microsoft is rolling out Bing generative search, a new feature that incorporates AI-powered summaries above traditional search results, similar to Google's AI Overviews.

data.Title: Apple Maps Web Version Enters Beta Testing
data.Description: Apple has released a beta version of Apple Maps for the web, allowing users to access the mapping service from their desktop browsers.

data.Title: Google Search Experiences Volatility and Updates
data.Description: Google Search has been experiencing ranking volatility and updates, with some SEOs reporting both positive and negative effects. Google is also testing new features, including larger sitenames and favicons in search results.

data.Title: Google's Q2 2024 Earnings Show Strong Ad Revenue Growth
data.Description: Google's parent company, Alphabet, reported strong Q2 2024 earnings, with ad revenue up 11% year-over-year to $64.62 billion. Overall revenue increased by 14% to $84.7 billion.

data.Title: Google to Include Ads Within AI Overviews
data.Description: Google plans to allow advertisers to place ads within AI overviews, providing a new way for businesses to reach users searching for information.

data.Title: Google Third-Party Cookies to Remain in Chrome
data.Description: After years of delays and uncertainty, Google has announced that it will not be deprecating third-party cookies in its Chrome browser. The company will continue to work on privacy-preserving alternatives.

data.Title: Reddit Blocks Bing and Other Search Engines, Sparking Controversy
data.Description: Reddit has updated its robots.txt file to block most search engines, including Microsoft Bing, from crawling its content. Google Search remains the only exception, following a reported $60 million deal with Reddit.
